description: The year is AD 2225. Kouji Aiba and Aoi Housen are serving as astronauts in-training in Liebe Delta which is located on the edge of the Geduld Sea. When saboteurs with unknown intents suddenly strike during a routine dive procedure, the space station plummets into the Geduld, a plasma field that links all the planets like a nervous system and crushes any ship that strays too far into it. With all the adults onboard killed, the young astronauts will have to survive this long journey home in midst of the growing tension amongst each other. Meanwhile the organizers of the sabotage look on and prepare to attack once more.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

title.native: 無限のリヴァイアス イリュージョン

name.native: コンラッド・ヴィスケス
グッド・タートルランド3世 (チャーリー)

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.

[Profile (JVC)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A014076.html)

Mika Arisaka is a Japanese-American singer and vocalist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/平井久司)

__Hisashi Hirai__ is a Japanese animator, designer, illustrator and mangaka. He is best known for his character design work on [Gundam SEED](https://anilist.co/anime/93/Mobile-Suit-Gundam-Seed/) and the Fafner series.

Currently a freelancer. He began his career as an in-betweener for [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production) and debuted in the 1983 TV series, [Cat's Eye](https://anilist.co/anime/2043/Cats-Eye/). He often worked on many outsourced episodes for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) shows as a key animator and animation director.

In 1992 he would work on [Dragon Slayer](https://anilist.co/anime/3025/Dragon-Slayer/). An animated adaptation of the 1989 video game Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes by Nihon Falcom, his first major character design credit. Since then, he became more active as a character designer on numerous series. Most notably for Sunrise productions such as [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/Infinite-Ryvius/), [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/), and the aforementioned Gundam SEED series; which he had won the Character Design Prize for at the 3rd Tokyo International Anime Fair in 2004.

Hirai is also said to be a close friend of director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi).

Katsuhisa Hattori was a Japanese classical composer who wrote music for anime films, television series, and OVAs. In the west, he was best known for his soundtrack compositions for [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/Argento-Soma/) and [Hiroyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/97473/Hiroyuki-Morioka)'s [Seikai](https://anilist.co/anime/290/Crest-of-the-Stars/) series.

Katsuhisa Hattori was a Japanese classical composer who wrote music for anime films, television series, and OVAs. In the west, he was best known for his soundtrack compositions for [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/Argento-Soma/) and [Hiroyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/97473/Hiroyuki-Morioka)'s [Seikai](https://anilist.co/anime/290/Crest-of-the-Stars/) series.

Katsuhisa Hattori was a Japanese classical composer who wrote music for anime films, television series, and OVAs. In the west, he was best known for his soundtrack compositions for [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/Argento-Soma/) and [Hiroyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/97473/Hiroyuki-Morioka)'s [Seikai](https://anilist.co/anime/290/Crest-of-the-Stars/) series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuichiro_takeda)

Yuuichirou Takeda is an anime scenario writer working at Sunrise. Most well known for his work on Infinite Ryvius, Seikai no Senki, Zipang and GaoGaiGar. He also worked on the Xenosaga anime as series creator, supervisor, and storyboarder.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖夫)

Founder of [Audio Planning U](https://anilist.co/studio/6561/), and the father of [Keiko](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/) and [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

In 2016, he received an Honorary Achievement Award for his role as a sound director in [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山根公利)

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

__Non-anime staff credits:__  
~!
TV Tokyo Staff member for "..hack//G.U. Vol.2//Reminisce" (VG)  
TV Tokyo Staff member for ".hack//G.U. Vol. 1//Rebirth" (VG)  
TV Tokyo Staff member for ".hack//G.U. Vol.3//Redemption" (VG)  !~

Founder of Studio Cosmos.

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.
__Rie Nagai__, better known as Rie, is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and vocalist.
__Kitagawa Keiko__ is a Japanese lyricist. Note: Not to confuse her with the much younger famous pop-star Kitagawa Keiko.

[Profile (JVC)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A014076.html)
